page.title: 18A walk around Frisby
page.content: Standing at the market or preaching cross,built in the 13th. century and moved from the middle of the road a few years ago,you can see Georgian Cottage built in 1767, which has an old water pump outside.Further along Rotherby Lane is the Old Institute and Zion House,a thatched cottage which has the date 1725 on the gable end.The Old Institute was used during World War Two as a Home Guard meeting place.Off Main St.and opposite Hollow Lane is Skinner's Yard where there was a butchers shop and slaughter house until 1973.At the end of Hollow Lane Glebe Cottage,timber framed and thatched, stands adjacent to the old vicarage,which dates in some parts from medieval times.Follow Carrfields Lane and Mill Lane to the Old Mill House where you can still see the millrace.The walk takes about 40 mins.
